sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The NTP package contains ntp-wait, ntptrace, ntpd, ntpdate, ntpdc, ntpq, ntptime, tickadj and ntp-keygen.

sect3.title: ntp-wait
sect3.para: ntp-wait is useful at boot time, to delay the boot sequence until ntpd has set the time.

sect3.title: ntptrace
sect3.para: ntptrace traces a chain of NTP servers back to the primary source.

sect3.title: ntpd
sect3.para: ntpd is a NTP daemon that runs in the background and keeps the date and time synchronized based on response from configured NTP servers. It also functions as a NTP server.

sect3.title: ntpdate
sect3.para: ntpdate is a client program that sets the date and time based on the response from an NTP server. This command is deprecated.

sect3.title: ntpdc
sect3.para: ntpdc is used to query the NTP daemon about its current state and to request changes in that state.

sect3.title: ntpq
sect3.para: ntpq is an utility program used to monitor ntpd operations and determine performance.

sect3.title: ntptime
sect3.para: ntptime reads and displays time-related kernel variables.

sect3.title: tickadj
sect3.para: tickadj reads, and optionally modifies, several timekeeping-related variables in older kernels that do not have support for precision timekeeping.

sect3.title: ntp-keygen
sect3.para: ntp-keygen generates cryptographic data files used by the NTPv4 authentication and identification schemes.
